name.description: The name of the service (used for app.kubernetes.io/name label)

fullname.description: The name of the service instance (used for resource names and app.kubernetes.io/instance label)

registry.description: The Registry containing the Docker Image to run (also used as the name of an optional Image Pull Secret)

repository.description: The name of the Docker Image image to run (without the Registry)

tag.description: The tag of the Docker Image to run (also used for app.kubernetes.io/version label)

pullPolicy.description: Set to Always to try to pull new versions of the Docker Image

args.description: The command-line arguments passed to the service

env.description: The environment variables passed to the service

config.description: YAML configuration to be mounted as a file in the container at $CONFIG_FILE

additionalConfigs.description: Additional ConfigMaps (with key named data.yaml) to be mounted and appended to $CONFIG_FILE

livenessProbe.description: Probe that causes the service to be restarted when failing

readinessProbe.description: Probe that prevents the service from receiving traffic when failing

labels.description: Additional labels to set on all generated resources

annotations.description: Additional annotations to set on the Pods

requests.description: The minimum resources requested/reserved for the service

limits.description: The maximum resources the service can use

replicas.description: The number of instances of the service to run (set at least 2 for Pod Disruption Budget)

enabled.description: Enables automatic starting of additional instances based on CPU load

maxReplicas.description: The maximum number of instances to run (must be larger than replicas)

targetCpu.description: The desired average CPU load in percent

rollingUpdate.description: Controls whether to wait for new versions to be up and running before shutting down old version

nodeSelector.description: Node labels required for scheduling this service, also used as tolerations

enabled.description: Enables persistent storage for the service

storageClass.description: The type of disk to use for storage instead of the cluster default

size.description: The size of the persistent volume to create for the service

mountPath.description: The mount path for the storage inside the container

name.description: The name of the Kubernetes Secret

mountPath.description: The mount path for the Secret inside the container

subPath.description: The path of a single file in the Secret relative to the given mountPath

files.description: Map of file names to base64-encoded content; leave empty to reference existing Secret

enabled.description: Enables ingress into the service (either cluster-internal or public)

port.description: The container port ingress traffic is routed to

protocol.description: The protocol used for ingress (e.g., http or grpc)

domains.description: The public domain names under which the service is exposed (leave empty for cluster-internal only)

paths.description: HTTP path prefixes to accept ingress traffic for (leave empty to accept traffic for any path)

class.description: The ingress controller to use (if ingress.domains is set and ingress.istio.enabled is false)

annotations.description: Annotations for Ingress resource (if ingress.domains is set and ingress.istio.enabled is false)

tls.description: TLS config for Ingress resource (if ingress.domains is set and ingress.istio.enabled is false)

enabled.description: Use Istio VirtualService instead of Kubernetes Ingress resource

gateways.description: The names of the Istio Gateways to use

enabled.description: Enable tracing with Jaeger agent (injected as sidecar)

probability.description: Probability of any single trace being sampled; can be overridden for incoming requests e.g. via Istio

enabled.description: Use Prometheus for monitoring / metrics scraping

port.description: The port to be scraped for monitoring data

path.description: The path to be scraped for monitoring data

interval.description: The interval at which monitoring data is scraped

enabled.description: Applies default alert rules like unavailable pods or RAM usage (if monitoring.enabled is true)

labels.description: Labels to apply to generic alert rules in addition to component and severity

thresholdFactor.description: The maximum factor (between 0 and 1) of memory usage allowed before alerting

sampleInterval.description: The time interval in which to measure ratio of HTTP 4xx responses for the current state

referenceInterval.description: The time interval in which to measure ratio of HTTP 4xx responses as a reference for the normal state

thresholdFactor.description: The maximum factor between the current state and the normal state of HTTP 4xx response ratio allowed

sampleInterval.description: The time interval in which to measure average HTTP response times for the current state

referenceInterval.description: The time interval in which to measure average HTTP response times for the normal state

thresholdFactor.description: The maximum factor between the current state and the normal state of HTTP response times allowed

sidecars.description: Additional sidecar containers to be added to the Pod

roles.description: Namespace-specific Kubernetes RBAC Roles to assign to the service

clusterRoles.description: Cluster-wide Kubernetes RBAC Roles to assign to the service
